paragraphs.zh-tw: （音樂）Angella Ahn﹕ 謝謝非常感謝
paragraphs.en: (Music) Angella Ahn: Thank you. Thank you so much.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們很榮幸能來到TEDWomen與大家分享我們的音樂多麽令人振奮、激勵人心的活動
paragraphs.en: We are so honored to be here at TEDWomen, sharing our music with you. What an exciting and inspiring event.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 剛才聽到的是David Balakrishnan的"Skylife"我們還要再演奏一曲
paragraphs.en: What you just heard is "Skylife" by David Balakrishnan. We want to play you one more selection.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 阿根廷作曲家阿斯妥•皮亞佐拉的作品在此所談的是不同的想法－皮亞佐拉有這樣的想法他認爲音樂應該發自內心
paragraphs.en: It's by Astor Piazzolla, an Argentine composer. And we talk about different ideas -- he had this idea that he thought music should be from the heart.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 在20世紀中葉這種發自內心的美妙音樂在當時的古典音樂世界裡並非最流行這種音樂較缺乏調性更趨近十二音技法
paragraphs.en: This was in the middle of the 20th century when music from the heart, beautiful music, wasn't the most popular thing in the classical music world. It was more atonal and twelve-tone.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 而他堅持這種美妙的音樂這就是皮亞佐拉的"遺忘"
paragraphs.en: And he insisted on beautiful music. So this is "Oblivion" by Astor Piazzolla.

title: Ahn Trio A Modern Take On Piano Violin Cello
